channel.title: Announcements on Jakarta® EE: The New Home of Cloud Native Java
channel.description: Recent content in Announcements on Jakarta® EE: The New Home of Cloud Native Java

item.title: Add Your Voice to the 2020 Jakarta EE Developer Survey
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Our third annual Jakarta EE Developer Survey is now open and I encourage everyone to take a few minutes and complete the survey before the April 30 deadline.

item.title: Jakarta EE Update Call - April 2020
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Join the next Jakarta EE community call on Wednesday, 8 April at 11 a.m. ET! Add the Community Call to your calendar & join the conversation.

item.title: Jakarta EE Update Call - March 2020
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Join the next Jakarta EE community call on Thursday, 18 March at 11 a.m. ET! Add the Community Call to your calendar & join the conversation.

item.title: Jakarta EE Update Call - February 2020
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Join the next Jakarta EE community call on Wednesday, 12 February at 11 a.m. ET! Add the Community Call to your calendar & join the conversation.

item.title: The Eclipse Foundation Announces the CN4J Day 2020 Event for Building Enterprise Java on Kubernetes
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: – Co-Located with Kubecon+CloudNativeCon Europe 2020, the March 30 event features speakers from IBM, Red Hat, Oracle and other enterprise Java leaders –

item.title: Moving Forward With Jakarta EE 9
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: On behalf of the Jakarta EE Working Group, we are excited to announce the unanimous approval of the plan for Jakarta EE 9, with an anticipated mid-2020 release.

item.title: Jakarta EE Update Call - January 2020
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Join the next Jakarta EE community call on Wednesday, 15 January 11 a.m. ET! Add the Community Call to your calendar & join the conversation.

item.title: Best practices for modern Enterprise Java projects - Jakarta Tech Talk
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Join us for Sebastian Daschner's Jakarta Tech Talk on Dec 10!

item.title: Jakarta EE Update Call - December 2019
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Join the next Jakarta EE community call on Wednesday, 11 December at 11 a.m. ET! Add the Community Call to your calendar & join the conversation.

item.title: Election Updates, Fall 2019
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: We are happy to announce Arjan Tijms as Elected Committer representative for the Steering Committee who is acclaimed to this role, as the only nominee. The seats at Marketing and Brand Committee will stay empty until the next election period since we did not have nominees

item.title: Payara Server is Jakarta EE 8 Compatible
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Payara Services and the Eclipse Foundation, Inc. today announced the application server, Payara Server, a Jakarta EE 8 compatible implementation.

item.title: The Eclipse Foundation Wins Duke’s Choice Award for Open Source Contributions to the Java Ecosystem
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: The Eclipse Foundation was awarded a Duke’s Choice Award in recognition for outstanding open source contributions to the Java ecosystem and the community-driven achievement of moving Java EE technologies from Oracle to the Jakarta EE Working Group.

item.title: The Eclipse Foundation Releases Jakarta EE 8 Specifications; Completes Transition to Eclipse Foundation as the New Home for Open Source Cloud Native Java
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: The Eclipse Foundation today announced during the JakartaOne Livestream virtual conference the release of the Jakarta EE 8 Full Platform and Web Profile specifications and related Technology Compatibility Kits (TCKs).

item.title: Welcome to the Future of Cloud Native Java
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Today, with the release of Jakarta EE 8, we’ve entered a new era in Java innovation.

item.title: Update for Jakarta EE community: September 2019
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: We hope you’re enjoying the Jakarta EE monthly email update, which seeks to highlight news from various committee meetings related to this platform.

item.title: Jakarta Newsletter August 2019: Jakarta EE 8 Preview
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Get the next issue of the Jakarta EE Newsletter that puts a spotlight on the present and future of Jakarta EE, the journey to Jakarta EE 8, JakartaOne Livestream and more!

item.title: Welcome Ivar Grimstad!
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: We are happy to announce effective October 1st, Ivar Grimstad will join the Eclipse Foundation in the role of Jakarta EE Developer Advocate.

item.title: Update for Jakarta EE community: August 2019
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: There’s a lot happening in the Jakarta EE ecosystem, read on to get richer insight into the work that has been invested in Jakarta EE.

item.title: Update for Jakarta EE community: July 2019
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Get the latest email update for the Jakarta EE community which highlights news from various committee meetings related to this platform.

item.title: Become a Sponsor at EclipseCon Europe 2019!
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: We're gearing up for EclipseCon Europe 2019, our biggest event of the year which brings together developers, architects, and open source business leaders.

item.title: Update for Jakarta EE community: June 2019
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Get the latest monthly email update on the Jakarta EE community from news highlights to various meetings and events related to the platform!

item.title: Election time for Jakarta EE Working Group Committees!
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: The Jakarta EE Working Group charter identifies three key committees to drive the various facets of the working group for which there are elected positions to be filled: the Steering Committee, the Specification Committee, and the Marketing and Brand Committee.

item.title: Cloud Native Java Innovation at the Eclipse Foundation
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: The world’s leading technology vendors, including Fujitsu, IBM, Microsoft, Oracle, Red Hat, SAP, and Tomitribe, are collaborating at the Eclipse Foundation to advance enterprise Java technologies to support the migration of mission-critical applications to the cloud.

item.title: Cloud Native Java Innovation at the Eclipse Foundation
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: The Jakarta EE community is the driving force behind the future of cloud-native Java.

item.title: The Cloud Native Imperative — Results from the 2019 Jakarta EE Developer Survey
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: The results of the 2019 Jakarta EE Developer Survey are out.

item.title: New Eclipse Foundation Community Survey of Java Developers Shows Cloud Native Adoption Accelerating Dramatically with Jakarta EE
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Eclipse Foundation enterprise Java survey shows cloud deployments increasing over 2018 findings with 62% of Java developers building cloud native architectures now or within the year

item.title: Update on Jakarta EE Rights to Java Trademarks
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Summary of progress to date and implications of the agreement between Eclipse and Oracle on Jakarta EE and use of Java trademarks and the javax namespace.

item.title: Jakarta EE Community Engagement
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: The intention of the blog is to list all the ways we currently (May 2019) engage with the community.

item.title: Renaming Java EE Specifications for Jakarta EE
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: When we first moved the APIs and TCKs for the Java EE specifications over to the Eclipse Foundation under the Jakarta EE banner, we kept the existing names for the specifications in place, and adopted placeholder names for the open source projects that hold their artifacts.

item.title: How to participate in advancing Jakarta EE Specification: Technical and Collateral material related work
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Technical Work: We will need a lot of help on this front as well

item.title: Thank You for Taking the Jakarta EE 2019 Developer Survey!
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: The Jakarta EE 2019 Developer Survey, organized by the Jakarta EE Working Group, is now closed. The survey wrapped up at midnight on Monday, March 25, with over 1,770 responses from developers around the globe. Truly an outstanding response from an amazing community!

item.title: How to participate in advancing Jakarta EE Specification
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: It is March already, and excitement for Jakarta EE is growing. The migration to Jakarta EE is almost complete! In the wake of the successful launch of the Java EE 8-compatible Eclipse GlassFish 5.1 in January, we are keeping our sights set firmly forward.

item.title: The 2019 Jakarta EE Developer Survey is underway!
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: The Jakarta EE Working Group is launching the Jakarta EE Developer Survey for 2019. This is an annual survey that delivers valuable insight into enterprise and cloud native programming languages, platforms, and infrastructure. As always, the results will be shared with everyone. You can find the insights and key findings from the survey we did in 2018.

item.title: Jakartablogs.ee is Live! PS: Bloggers, We Need You!
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Just in time for the Eclipse 5.1 GA release January 29, 2019 , we are happy to announce that our new Jakartablogs.ee blog aggregator is live!

item.title: Java EE 8 Compatible Eclipse GlassFish 5.1 Released
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Eclipse Foundation completes migration of 13.5 million lines of code in 95,000 files with full testing of open source TCK and proprietary Oracle TCK

item.title: Eclipse releases GlassFish 5.1 for Java EE 8
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Eclipse Foundation reaches a key Jakarta EE milestone with the release of its own GlassFish application server

item.title: Announcing Eclipse GlassFish 5.1.0-RC1 release
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: I am very excited to say that Eclipse GlassFish 5.1-RC1 is now released!

item.title: Introducing the Jakarta EE Specification Process
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: I am very happy to announce that we are publishing a draft of the Eclipse Foundation Specification Process for community review and feedback

item.title: Jakarta EE Status – September 2018 Update
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Migrating Java EE to the Eclipse Foundation and Jakarta EE is a process not an event. In the past couple of weeks however, several very important milestones have occurred that deserve to be recognized.

item.title: Java EE TCK is now open sourced at Eclipse Foundation
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: A major milestone was achieved this September 2018! The Jakarta EE TCKs are here and finally open sourced! It was long wished for and waited on by many. But what exactly does that mean?

item.title: Welcoming GlassFish to the Eclipse Foundation
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: A major milestone was achieved yesterday! The GlassFish code from Oracle made its home in the Eclipse Foundation's Git repositories, starting a new era of Eclipse GlassFish. This is another step in making Jakarta EE a vehicle for innovation in cloud-native application development.

item.title: Eclipse Foundation Announces Jakarta EE Committee Election Results
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Ottawa, Canada - July 31, 2018 - Today we are pleased to announce the results of the Participant and Committer Member elections for representatives to the Jakarta EE Working Group Steering Committee, Specification Committee, and Marketing & Brand Committee. These committees provide governance for the evolution and adoption of Jakarta EE, the community-led platform created from the contribution of Java EE technologies and hosted by the Eclipse Foundation.

item.title: Jakarta EE Marketing and Social Media Update
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: An update on our marketing efforts to promote awareness, contributions, adoption, and support of Jakarta EE.

item.title: Jakarta EE Newsletter - A First Look
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: The first issue of the Jakarta EE quarterly newsletter has been published. Read it now!

item.title: Jakarta EE Progress to Date
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Last September Oracle announced, with the support of IBM and Red Hat, that Java EE was going to move to the Eclipse Foundation.

item.title: Jakarta EE at EclipseCon France 2018
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Meet the community at the Unconference and take in the talks on Jakarta EE, MicroServices, Microprofile and EE4J, June 11-13 in Toulouse.

item.title: Eclipse Foundation Unveils New Cloud Native Java Future with Jakarta EE
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Future evolution of Java EE, Jakarta EE stack moves to the Eclipse Foundation.

item.title: Jakarta EE Community Survey of 1,800+ Java Developers Reveals “Cloud Native” Top Requirement in Platform’s Evolution
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: The Eclipse Foundation conducts largest survey to date of Java community on key priorities for future releases of Jakarta EE.
